item.title: Leaves from council trees not cleared, 30th November
item.description:
Leaves from council trees have not been cleared in Kenwood drive this autumn, previous complaints have not been dealt with. Residents clear leaves which blow into their gardens from the council trees and put in to recycling garden waste but the council do not do their part of clearing the leaves.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kenwood Drive, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street once again used as a dumping ground, 30th November
item.description:
This area is repeatedly being used as a dumping ground by neighbouring buildings and businesses. A variety of items, including furniture, have been left strewn around. People are also using the space as a place to relieve themselves. The rubbish needs to be removed and the street thoroughly cleaned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dorrit Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Next to number 2!, 30th November
item.description:
This is the second time reporting this issue. Apparently your crew “Crew” didn’t see it on their first visit (today), which is odd because it is very difficult to miss! I would be amazed if they didn’t see it on their second visit. I have attached a picture; they are looking for a disused wooden pallet. Please can this be removed?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hopefield Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak and surface water runoff on footpath, 30th November
item.description:
Water is rising and leaking out on to the pavement outside the JDM Estate Agents/Tanning Salon as indicated on the attached photograph. This has been ongoing for several weeks and has now become extremely dangerous as the outside temperature drops, as it is highly likely the wide yet shallow runoff resulting from the leak will freeze. The surface area covered by the leak is considerable, running down the footpath and spreading across it, since the point of the leak is on a hill. The second photograph is included for scale of the leak. This needs fixing urgently as I am concerned that pedestrians may be injured if the water does freeze, or will be forced to use the road as access which has other safety related implications.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, High Street, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
